message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the recently compiled database of small and medium-sized enterprises in Jordan, this paper assesses the effect of firm size on their productivity levels.", "dataset": ["database of small and medium-sized enterprises in Jordan"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]},{"sentence": "This research employs household survey data from the Mexican Family Life Survey (MxFLS) to estimate the impact of remittances on the poverty headcount and inequality in Mexico.", "dataset": ["Mexican Family Life Survey (MxFLS)"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We use spatio-temporal temperature data generated by the NASA Global Earth Observing System and epidemiological surveillance data from the Brazilian Ministry of Health to analyze the relationship between climate and dengue transmission dynamics.", "dataset": ["NASA Global Earth Observing System", "Brazilian Ministry of Health"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines fine-grained data on informal firms' behavior with worker switching costs estimated from an experiment conducted in Ivory Coast.", "dataset": ["data on informal firms' behavior"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "The analysis uses data from two large-scale public employment programs, namely Private Sector Participation Program (PSPP) and Social Safety Net Employment Program (SSNEP), implemented in urban Bangladesh to investigate the effectiveness of labor market policies on reducing gender-based wage discrimination.", "dataset": ["Private Sector Participation Program (PSPP)", "Social Safety Net Employment Program (SSNEP)"], "topic": ["Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This paper exploits a unique dataset that links national household surveys to fiscal data at the individual level to analyze the extent to which cash transfer programs increase income mobility in Colombia.", "dataset": ["national household surveys", "fiscal data at the individual level"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from World Bank's Women, Business and the Law index and the Global Entrepreneurship Monitor to examine how legal gender differences and socio-cultural norms affect women's entrepreneurship activity across countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Women, Business and the Law index", "Global Entrepreneurship Monitor"], "topic": ["Gender", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This research relies on a newly digitized database of over 6,700 Spanish lawsuits involving land spanning the years between 1791 and 1860 to study the impact of property rights histories on present-day development outcomes in the country.", "dataset": ["digitized database of over 6,700 Spanish lawsuits involving land"], "topic": ["Governance", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "By merging multiple datasets - US Census Bureau Local Employment Dynamics, LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics and Zip Code Business Patterns - this research evaluates the effect of Hurricane Sandy on employment and business establishments in the New Jersey-New York Metropolitan area", "dataset": ["US Census Bureau Local Employment Dynamics", "LEHD Origin-Destination Employment Statistics", "Zip Code Business Patterns"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management ", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using multilevel regression with poststratification (MRP) analysis, we match recently released survey data from the Pew Research Center on policy preferences in the United States to data on the geographic dispersion of the elderly population extracted from the 2010 US Census Bureau", "dataset": ["survey data from the Pew Research Center", "2010 US Census Bureau"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Regional Integration"]}]
